Complex laminated body.Definition: Cytoplasmic organelles described in some lateral geniculate neurons composed of sheets of tubules (25 nm in diameter) separated by dense material (about 75 nm wide), which together with the tubules whorl give a structure resembling a 'finger-print '. In 2 um thick Epon-Araldite sections stained with methylene-blue and Azure II, CLBs are dark blue, round or oval bodies of the same order of size as the nucleolus.
